JCLKeywords.DD *:
__ The DD * Operation Field__

Defines an in-stream data set which cannot contain JCL statements
JCLKeywords.DD DATA:
__ The DD Data Operation Field__

Defines an in-stream data set which can contain JCL statements.
JCLKeywords.DD:
__ The DD Operation Field__

Describes each data set and requests the allocation of I/O devices.
JCLKeywords.EXEC:
__The EXEC PGM Operation Field__

Marks the beginning of a job step; optionally assigns a name to the step; identifies the program or the cataloged or in-stream procedure to be executed in this step.
JCLKeywords.JCLLIB:
__The JCLLIB Operation Field__

Instruction to search for the procedures executed by this job in the specified library prior to searching the system library.
JCLKeywords.JOB:
__The JOB Operation Field__

The first control statement. Marks the beginning of a job; assigns a name to the job.
JCLKeywords.JOBCAT:
__The JOBCAT Operation Field__

Instruction to use the specified catalog for this job rather than the system catalog.
JCLKeywords.PROC:
__The PROC Operation Field__

Marks the beginning of an in-stream procedure and may mark the beginning of a cataloged procedure; assigns default values to parameters defined in the procedure.
JCLKeywords.STEPCAT:
__ The STEPCAT Operation Field__

Instruction to use the specified catalog for this step rather than the system catalog.
JCLKeywords.STEPLIB:
__ The STEPLIB Operation Field__

Instruction to search for the program executed by this step in the specified library prior to searching the system library.
JCLKeywords.XMIT:
__Operation Field__

Use the XMIT command to transmit files to another JES node

JCLParameters.CLASS:
__JOB Parameter__

Run job in this CLASS
JCLParameters.COND:
__EXEC Parameter__

Do not execute this job step if this condition is TRUE
JCLParameters.CREATE:

Perform a file create.

Data Control Block

JCLParameters.DDNAME:
__Data Definition Parameter__

Refer to the named DD statement for attributes of this dataset
JCLParameters.DELETE:

Perform a file delete.

JCLParameters.DLM:
__Data Definition Parameter__

Two-character delimiter to indicate the end of in-stream data
JCLParameters.DSORG:

Dataset Organisation: typically PO(partitioned)|PS(sequential)
JCLParameters.DUMMY:
__Data Definition Parameter__

No I/O is to be performed on this dataset.  READ gives EOF and WRITE does nothing
JCLParameters.LABEL:

Tape label:  Specify nth file to access, and its label type

JCLParameters.OUTLIM:

JCLParameters.PARM:

Parameter string to pass to problem program named in the PGM field
JCLParameters.PASSWORD:

JCLParameters.PATH:

Pathname of USS file.  Pathname is case-sensitive
JCLParameters.PGM:

JCLParameters.REGION:

JCLParameters.RESTART:

Retention period for dataset
JCLParameters.ROOM:

JCLParameters.SPACE:

JCLParameters.SYSAFF:

LPAR on which to run this job
JCLParameters.SYSIN:

In-stream dataset.
JCLParameters.SYSOUT:
__ The SYSOUT Data Definition Parameter__

Use the SYSOUT parameter to identify this data set as a system output data set, usually called a sysout data set.
JCLParameters.SYSPRINT:
__ The SYSPRINT Data Definition Parameter__

Use the SYSPRINT parameter to identify this data set as a system output data set, usually used by utility programs.
JCLParameters.SYSPUNCH:
__ The SYSPUNCH Data Definition Parameter__

The SYSPUNCH data set is a temporary data set containing object modules assembled by running the job stream produced by system generation or the GENERATE command.
